intro: Chloraea perez-moreaui, commonly known as the Perú yellow orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow petals and intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in high-altitude cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are often fragrant and bloom during the spring and early summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
